Title: Finxact - Software Developer
Job_Description:
The Software Test Engineer (STE) role is critical to the business and technology mission of CardConnect. Specifically, the STE will design, implement, execute and report on tests that exercise all aspects of CardConnect application software during development projects and prior to implementation. This testing will include system-level API coverage in advance of user interface deployment. It is expected that these tests will include considerable automation that can be integrated into the overall build and deployment process.

TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Review requirements and other project documentation for completeness and testability given project scope and timeline
Develop, implement and execute appropriate tests within established project schedules so that an understanding of discovered issues vs. goals for deliverable quality can be made known
Contribute to overall team automation approach by integrating relevant, value-added and well-produced automated tests into the build and deployment of software products
Communicate and document testing progress, results and other relevant information regarding the testing of application project assignments to peers, leaders and product development teams
Maintain testing and other process and project-related documentation in response to ongoing improvement and evolution of products and resulting test approach over time
Collaborate with technology organization to advise on best practices for testing tools, strategy and techniques to integrate Quality in the entire product life cycle
Establish subject matter knowledge of all aspects regarding our Payment Card processing business logic and merchant onboarding processes and how these are realized in our applications.



Working knowledge of testing web applications that are integrated with SQL and noSQL databases, java-based application servers, queuing service middleware, and internal/external API’s, with the need to perform end to end validation of business processes with multiple verification points
Demonstrated experience with test automation of web applications with complex business logic
Background in automated testing development through Java-based tools (Gauge, Selenium WebDriver)
Able to troubleshoot technical issues when assembling concise, complete and actionable defect reports
Experience with testing native mobile applications and supporting web services is a plus
Knowledge of Continuous Integration Frameworks such as Jenkins and GoCD
Established application of critical and systems thinking to the detailed testing of business systems
Some knowledge of electronic payment products and providers, functional and technical, is helpful



Software testing professional that contributes to a high level of credibility within the testing team
Positive, ‘can-do’ attitude with a focus on team success through collaboration
‘Systems Thinker’ who can learn how our applications work, then apply that knowledge in high-value testing engagement on projects
Must be able to take on the challenge of a fast-paced environment with high rates of change
Effective and objective communicator, presenting facts without bias regarding assigned tasks
Takes ownership of outstanding issues with accountability for their outcome
Respects other’s opinions and suggestions, works to create an environment of trust and empathy
Superior time management skills and an organizational ability to plan out working assignments to completion
The ability to discern flexibility from compromise when it comes to testing software as a profession
Learning about software testing never ceases. It is a craft the requires continued learning and acquisition of new skills. We invest in the development of our team members, but we expect personal responsibility for professional growth initiatives.

ACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENT

The role manages the Asset Liability Management (ALM) and Treasury areas of the Financial Risk Management (FRM) function. The role will assist the Senior Vice President of Financial Risk Management (FRM) in carrying out the broader FRM department mission, including interest rate risk and liquidity risk management.

The FRM function in part refers to the treasury and ALM imperative. This includes running and maintaining various financial models including the ALM model, fund transfer pricing model, economic capital model and secondary models in support of integrated financial risk management. ALM and Treasury is responsible for the two broad financial risks: market risk (interest rate risk) and liquidity risk. The Team’s mandate is to balance risks and their corresponding returns through: Identifying, Monitoring, Managing and communicating these risks to the senior management.

The incumbent manages the integration of financial risks through state-of-the-art economic capital and ALM modeling, translating into impactful balance sheet strategies and achieving regulatory requirements. This includes back testing, regulatory stress testing, assumption development (deposit lives & re-pricing, asset prepays) calibration of all models and other modeling/forecasting responsibilities as needs arise. The team is also responsible for the monthly ALCO package, annual regulatory examination, balance sheet strategy development, and performing summary & detailed written analysis on all model results. FRM also maintains documentation of all models and methodologies, including a model catalog with documentation and testing of all model changes. The team will work closely with the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) and Accounting teams on a day to day basis. The team is also responsible for analyzing historical balance sheet growth and pricing trends, used to develop forecast for the budget/annual operating plan (AOP).

The incumbent will have direct reports (2 managers) and will manage the ALM and Treasury function, at the direction of the SVP. The span of control will be at least 4. The VP is responsible for developing team goals and benchmarking team performance on a day to day basis.

This is a highly technical, high visibility role, with a tremendous ability to impact strategy and bottom-line. The incumbent may come up with new solutions that have not previously applied and have the discretions to implement.

What does a Sr Big Data Engineer do?
As an experienced member of our Data Engineering Platform Group you will be responsible for building and taking ownership over the successful design and development of data engineering projects within Fiserv’s Enterprise Data Analytics division. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the data engineering lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will Lead large-scale data engineering, integration and warehousing projects, build custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs and write complex and efficient queries to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Java, Python, and SQL. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to Architect, build, and launch new data models that provide intuitive analytics to the team and Build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.

Title: Application Analyst - Business Objects and Data Warehouse
Job_Description:
What does a great Data Analyst do?

The Card Services Data Analysts are part of a team who works directly with new clients to convert their existing credit card portfolios onto Fiserv processing platforms. The team is comprised of project managers, data analysts, and conversion programmers who perform the initial review of a converting client’s data files, develop an extensive list of reports and utilize custom tools to analyze the data, develop technical specifications for converting the data, present the specifications to the client, write the conversion programs and processes, and assist with the testing/loading processes. These positions offer a variety of opportunities to work in both business and technical roles. The roles provide a unique opportunity to use both technical and analytical skills, knowledge of the payment processing industry, and the soft skills required to work effectively with clients.

In this role, you will:
o Designing and documenting complex technical requirements for business applications
o Partnering with business analysts to identify business needs and appropriate technical solutions
o Creation of data conversion mapping specifications
o Ensuring quality of data conversion output including holding quality inspections
o Validating offline System and Output testing of data conversion files
o Debugging complex code and processes
o Planning and participating in mocks and other client events in conjunction with client and Fiserv partners
o Building partnerships with clients, product owners, application development teams, and program management colleagues
o Adherence to internal processes and best practices
o Monitoring and reporting progress
o Identification of risks and issues; managing and escalating appropriately

Qualifications for Consideration:
